summary: The Symposium of Asian Association for Algorithms and Computation (AAAC) 2025 will be held at the City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, China, from May 31 to June 1, 2025. The conference invites submissions of abstracts in all areas of theoretical computer science, with a focus on algorithm design and analysis, and complexity theory. The event is in-person, and accepted papers will be presented. Keynote speakers include Yossi Azar and Eunjung Kim. The submission deadline is February 28, 2025, with early registration due April 25, 2025. The registration fees are 1800 HKD for normal registration, and 900 HKD for students. The conference will also give the Best Student Presentation Award. Please refer to the provided website for the registration link and more details about the program.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

AAAC 2025: The 16th Annual Meeting of Asian Association for Algorithms and Computation

The 16th Annual Meeting of Asian Association for Algorithms and Computation (AAAC) will be held at the City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, China, on May 31 and June 1, 2025. We invite submissions of abstracts presenting original research or surveys in theoretical computer science. The conference is a face-to-face event, and all presenters must register and attend.

## Topics of Interest

*   Design and analysis of algorithms
*   Complexity theory
*   All areas of theoretical computer science

## Important Dates

1.  **Submission due: February 28 (Fri), 2025 (AoE)**
2.  **Notification: March 28 (Fri), 2025**
3.  **Camera-ready version due: April 18 (Fri), 2025**
4.  **Early Registration due: April 25 (Fri), 2025**
5.  **Conference Dates: May 31(Sat)- June 1(Sun), 2025**

## Submission Guidelines

Authors are invited to submit one-page (A4) abstracts in PDF format. These abstracts can be based on original research or surveys of existing results. Informal working notes, including the one-page abstracts, will be distributed at the meeting, which does not prevent future publication of the same work. All submissions should be made electronically through the EasyChair Conference System: [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=aaac2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=aaac2025).

## Registration Fees

*   **Normal registration: 1800 HKD**
*   **Student registration: 900 HKD**

## Best Student Presentation Award

The Best Student Presentation will be awarded. A paper presentation is eligible if the presenter is a full-time student. The award will be selected by AAAC board members during the meeting.

## Registration

Register for the conference here: [Registration Link](https://www.hkws.org/registration/aaac2025/reg.html)

## Note:
*   **Early bird registration deadline is April 25 (Fri), 2025.**

summary: The Applied Computing Conference (ACC) 2025 will be held in Porto, Portugal, from November 1st to 3rd, 2025. The conference focuses on addressing key technical issues in applied computing and related fields. ACC 2025 features a blind peer-review process, and accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings with an ISBN and DOI. Extended versions of selected papers will be considered for publication in the IADIS Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems. The conference welcomes submissions, and the deadline for the first call for papers is May 23, 2025.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers for the Applied Computing Conference (ACC) 2025

We invite submissions to the Applied Computing Conference (ACC) 2025, which aims to address key issues within the applied computing area and related fields. This conference focuses on technical aspects, offering a platform for researchers and practitioners to share their work.

## Topics of Interest

The conference covers a wide range of topics within applied computing, including but not limited to:

*   Detailed areas will be available on the conference website.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline (1st CFP):** May 23, 2025
*   **Notification to Authors (1st CFP):** June 23, 2025
*   **Final Camera-Ready Submission and Early Registration (1st CFP):** Until July 18, 2025
*   **Late Registration (1st CFP):** After July 18, 2025
*   **Conference:** November 1 – 3, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions should be made via the conference system: [Here](https://conf-system.org/confman_ac2025/author_new.asp).
*   This is a blind peer-reviewed conference.
*   The conference proceedings will be published in the form of a book and digital copy with ISBN.
*   The conference official language is English.

## Publication

*   The proceedings of the conference will be published in the form of a book and digital copy with ISBN.
*   Each published paper in IADIS Conferences’ Proceedings will be allocated a DOI (Digital Object Identifier) number for its fast and easy citation and indexation.
*   The conference proceedings will be submitted (pending approval) to the following indexing services (among others).
*   Extended versions of the best papers will be selected to be published in the IADIS Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems (ISSN: 1646-3692) indexed by Emerging Sources Citation Index by Thomson Reuters.

## Registration / Rates

*   Check conference rates and registration form [Here](https://www.computing-conf.org/registration/).

summary: The 45th IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems (ICDCS 2025) will be held in Glasgow, Scotland from July 20-23, 2025. The conference serves as a premier forum for researchers and practitioners to present, discuss, and exchange cutting-edge ideas and the latest findings on all aspects of distributed computing systems. The conference invites submissions of original research papers. Key dates include abstract registration by December 11, 2024, and paper submission by December 18, 2024. Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings, and a selection of papers will be considered for publication in the IEEE Transactions on Parallel and Distributed Systems (TPDS).
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 45th IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems (ICDCS 2025) invites submissions of original research contributions. The conference will be held in Glasgow, Scotland, UK from July 20-23, 2025.

## Topics of Interest

ICDCS 2025 welcomes papers on all aspects of distributed computing systems, including but not limited to:

*   Cloud Computing
*   Distributed Algorithms
*   Big Data, Models & Systems
*   Distributed Fault Tolerance
*   Distributed OS and Middleware
*   Edge Computing
*   IoT + CPS
*   Mobile Computing
*   Security, Privacy and Trust
*   Blockchains/Databases
*   Distributed Systems for AI/ML
*   AI/ML for Distributed Systems
*   Deployed/Emergent Applications & Infrastructures

## Important Dates (Anywhere on Earth - AoE)

*   Abstract Registration: **December 4, 2024** (Extended to **December 11, 2024**)
*   Paper Submission: **December 11, 2024** (Extended to **December 18, 2024**)
*   Author Notification: **April 2, 2025**
*   Camera-Ready Submission: **April 16, 2025**

## Submission Guidelines

*   All papers must be original and unpublished, and not submitted concurrently for publication elsewhere.
*   Submissions must follow the IEEE 8.5″ x 11″ two-column format using 10pt fonts and the IEEE Conference template (downloadable via the IEEE-Template Selector: [https://template-selector.ieee.org/](https://template-selector.ieee.org/)).
*   Each submission can have up to eleven (11) pages (including figures, tables, appendices, and references).
*   Papers exceeding the page limit or with smaller fonts will be desk-rejected without review.
*   The paper review process is double-blind. Authors must take all reasonable steps to preserve anonymity.
*   To encourage reproducibility, authors are encouraged to include in their paper a link to an anonymized GitHub repository with all source code, scripts, and data needed for the reproduction of their results.

## Submission Website

*   [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icdcs2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icdcs2025) (Submission portal opens on 1 November 2024)

## Publication

*   Accepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings.
*   A set of highly selected IEEE ICDCS 2025 papers will be considered for publication in the IEEE Transactions on Parallel and Distributed Systems (TPDS) (subject to an extension and review process).

## Registration

*   For each accepted paper, at least one author is required to pay a full author registration and attend the conference in-person to present their work on-site. Any no-show papers will be reported to the publisher and removed from the conference proceedings. For authors with multiple papers accepted by the conference, a separate author registration is required for each paper.

>   *Note:* Authors must adhere to the IEEE Code of Ethics and the IEEE Policy on AI-Generated Text.

## Contact

*   For inquiries, email: [icdcs2025@easychair.org](mailto:icdcs2025@easychair.org)

summary: The AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence, sponsored by the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence, serves as a premier venue for the presentation of AI research. The conference fosters intellectual exchange among researchers and practitioners, with a technical program featuring original research and panel discussions. The upcoming conference, the Fortieth Conference on Artificial Intelligence, is scheduled for January 20-27, 2026, at the Singapore EXPO.
callForPapers:
# AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

The AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence promotes theoretical and applied AI research as well as intellectual interchange among researchers and practitioners. The technical program features substantial, original research and practices. Conference panel discussions and invited presentations identify significant social, philosophical, and economic issues influencing AI’s development throughout the world.

## Future Conferences

The [Fortieth Conference on Artificial Intelligence](https://aaai.org/conference/aaai/aaai-26/) will be held in Singapore EXPO from **January 20 to January 27, 2026**.
